document.heading: Unemployment Trust Fund Revenue Temporary Act of 1981

history.narrative: Law 4-86, the “Unemployment Trust Fund Revenue Temporary Act of 1981,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 4-378, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 15, 1981, and January 5, 1982, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 18, 1982, it was assigned Act No. 4-140 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. Law 4-86 was repealed by § 3 of Law 4-147, effective September 17, 1982.
